ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about silkscreen printing! This course covered all the basics and taught us how to bitmap and print photos and digital files too. I learned everything about introductory silkscreen printing from reclaiming screens to coating them to exposing them to washing them and printing!
I learned all the ins and outs of the silkscreen printing process. In addition, I learned a lot about contemporary and past printing trends and production.
how to silkscreen print, use printshop materials and equipment, info about publishing, a lot!

Preparing and producing screens for printing, examples of screenprinted work and artists, color separation, how to identify different print techniques, how to screenprint on different substrates (paper, textiles, etc).
New techniques for creating and evaluating different forms of printmaking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course teaches you so much about silkscreen printing and Alex is the best professor. He is so helpful and you learn a lot of printing!

I really liked the guest speakers. They were all very kind and I really enjoyed how honest they were about the business side of art making. I also thought we had just the right amount of projects to work on.

Projects are time consuming and you need to be in the workshop to use the printing equipment, and there are limited hours when you can go to the workshop, so that made completing projects a bit difficult. But other than that the course was great and so fun!!
Loved the emphasis on individual and group projects! Combining structured learning with ample studio time made for an enjoyable, relaxed environment

This class was very engaging and fun for the students. I enjoyed the balance of time to work and time to critique. The frequent trips to museums also made the techniques we were learning feel tangible.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you want to learn about silkscreen printing this class is great! Alex makes it a wonderful time and is so helpful. Keep in mind you can only work in the printshop and there are limited hours. It is a demanding course due to the time you need to spend in the printshop, but if you're up for it, it is so worth it!
Yes, absolutelygreat for anyone interested in learning a new printmaking technique
Yes, if they are willing to put in the time to learn a new technique, the class is very rewarding.
